poem:
### Rebuilding

In Gaza's corridors, where echoes of loss linger,  
Dr. Abed stitches hope with calloused fingers.  
Among the rubble, dreams of healing rise,  
A bridge to futures under distant skies.  
From charred wards to Australian shores,  
He gathers knowledge to mend a land that implores—  
In each heart he tends, a promise to restore.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dr Abed has watched Gaza’s healthcare system crumble. He hopes studying in Australia will help him rebuild it Junior paediatrician Abdalkarim Alharazin has seen more suffering and death in Gaza than some doctors do in their entire careers. The 28-year-old, who goes by the name Dr Abed, has spent the last two years moving between hospitals putting to use his medical training to treat fellow Palestinians as they have endured relentless Israeli bombardment, forced displacement,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
